Award.AwardTitle: CAREER: Plasmonic Laser Nanosurgery Using Molecularly Targeted Gold Nanoparticles

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
0846868
Ben-Yakar

This proposal describes a research program that will explore a new method for high precision nanosurgery of living systems called plasmonic laser nanosurgery (PLN). In PLN, nanoparticles act like "nano-lenses" by focusing the laser energy to a small, confined region near their surface creating nanoscale cuts at the locations where they are attached. By attaching nanoparticles to targeted cellular structures, regions of tissue can be illuminated with a large laser spot, vaporizing only the targeted structures with a precision of 50 nm or less, while leaving all surrounding areas undamaged.
